creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Tenchi's poem:
(My hermitage
Loacated by a rice puddy 
In autumn field
Because my thatched room got loose
Dew drops coming through to wet my sleeve)
{Aki no ta no
Kario no io no
Toma wo arami
Waga koromode wa
Tsuyu ni nure tsutsu}
; followed by a detailed explanation of the poem
markings: Red artist's seal: {Ichiyū}; Publisher: Ebisu; Carver: Horikatsu (unknown)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Illustrations of the Hundred Poems by the Hundred Poets (Hyakunin isshu no uchi)
title: Illustration of the Emperor Tenchi's Poem
